question_text: A 33-year-old man with ulcerative colitis is evaluated for the recent onset of cholestatic liver disease.Magnetic resonance cholangiopancreatography results are shown.
question_stem: Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
critique: The most likely diagnosis is primary sclerosing cholangitis (PSC) (Option D), an autoimmune fibroinflammatory disease of the bile ducts. PSC is associated with inflammatory bowel disease in more than 70% of cases (primarily ulcerative colitis); conversely, up to 7.5% of patients with ulcerative colitis have PSC. The diagnosis of PSC can be made noninvasively through magnetic resonance cholangiopancreatography (MRCP) (shown).
